I think you should not underestimate the expertise of modern scholars working in the field of Arabic literature. In my experience, ordinary texts (e.g. historians) can be read without difficulty even if all the dots are missing. Scholars who work with old manuscripts do it all the time. Obviously, ornate literary texts (e.g. poetry) are difficult to read even with all the dots and the vowel signs as well.

I do it, too -- almost everyday. As I wrote, in many cases (or even most) cases it is no problem.
